alert.note: Alert for Caroline; Essex; King and Queen; Lancaster; Middlesex; New Kent; Northumberland; Richmond; Westmoreland (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 02 at 6:28PM EDT until June 02 at 9:00PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM EDT FOR NORTHWESTERN MIDDLESEX...KING AND QUEEN...NORTHWESTERN NORTHUMBERLAND...RICHMOND...NORTHWESTERN NEW KENT...WESTMORELAND... EAST CENTRAL CAROLINE...SOUTHEASTERN HANOVER...KING WILLIAM...ESSEX AND WESTERN LANCASTER COUNTIES... At 627 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Wicomico River to Dunnsville to near King And Queen Court House, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and powerlines. These severe storms will be near... Sharps around 635 PM EDT. Farnham, Coles Point, Haynesville, Morattico and Hague around 640 PM EDT. Robley, Callao, Church View and Jamaica around 645 PM EDT. Lewisetta around 655 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these severe thunderstorms include Beazley, Currioman Landing, Lottsburg, Threeway, Cohoke, Belle Isle State Park, Rose Garden, Biscoe, Lyells and Crouch. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.

area.areaDesc: Caroline; Essex; King and Queen; Lancaster; Middlesex; New Kent; Northumberland; Richmond; Westmoreland
